DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Related Genetic Future Research Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not the participant consents genetic testing on samples donated to a biobank for future research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specimen Related Genetic Future Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to consent to use a specimen for future genetic research.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:A time that is yet to come.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
A time that is yet to come.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent given for the patient's tissue and/or blood samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant agree to
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree to permit genetic testing on the samples donated to the ACSR biobank for future research to learn about, prevent, diagnose, or treat HIV-related diseases and cancer?
